Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention provides L-peptides and synthetic D-amino acid substituted peptides isolated, purified and characterized from frogs Clinotarsus curtipes and Hylarana temporalis of the Western Ghats, Kerala region of India. Peptides profiles are herein described according to their killing kinetics of Gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, red blood cell haemolysis and cytotoxic effect on cultured mammalian cells.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:E. coli (NCLM 2064) (MIC=20 µg/ml), P. aeruginosa (ATCC 10145) (MIC=40 µg/ml), V. cholerae (PL 91) (MIC=60 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:B. cereus (NCLM 2156) (MIC=150 µg/ml), S. aureus (ATCC25923) (MIC=40 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Showes higher antimicrobial activity against Gram-negative than against Gram-positive bacteria.

Literature.Title: Three novel antimicrobial peptides from the skin of the Indian bronzed frog Hylarana temporalis (Anura Ranidae).
Literature.Author: Reshmy V, Preeji V, Parvin A, Santhoshkumar K, George S.
